src:
Sukses Hari Pertama, Modal Timnas Panjat Tebing Di IFSC ACC Asian Championship 2019
07 Nov 2019, 09:22 by Danang Sundoro



Sukses Hari Pertama, Modal Timnas Panjat Tebing Di IFSC ACC Asian Championship 2019



Sukses Hari Pertama, Modal Timnas Panjat Tebing Di IFSC ACC Asian Championship 2019


KBRN, Bogor : Timnas panjat tebing tuan rumah Indonesia hingga saat ini terus berjuang pada hari kedua Kejuaraan Panjat Tebing bertajuk IFSC ACC Asian Championship 2019 di Stadion Pakansari, Bogor, Kamis (7/11/2019).  Indonesia tercatat mendominasi nomor speed relay putra dan putri dengan meraih 4 medali pada hari pertama Asian Championship 2019 di Stadion Pakansari, Bogor. Dua medali emas dari nomor speed relay putra dan putri, ditambah dua medali perak dari nomor speed relay putra dan putri.Timnas Indonesia Putri A yang meraih medali emas beranggotakan Nurul Iqamah, Raji'ah Sallsabillah, dan Amanda Narda Mutia. Di babak final, tim ini mencatatkan waktu total 24,942 detik.Sedangkan Timnas Indonesia Putri B yang meraih medali perak terdiri dari Dhorifatus Syafi'iyah, Mudji Mulyani, dan Berthdigna Devi. Mereka menorehkan waktu 28,015 detik.Untuk medali perunggu di nomor speed relay putri diraih oleh tim asal Kazakhstan dengan catatan waktu 32,024 detik. Tim ini beranggotakan Marienova Assel, Ulzhabayeva Tamara, dan Agambayeva Margarita.Sementara itu di nomor speed relay putra, Timnas Indonesia Putra A berhasil mengalahkan kompatriotnya, Timnas Indonesia Putra B, dengan catatan waktu 23,492 detik. Timnas Indonesia Putra A yang meraih medali emas beranggotakan Sabri, Rahmat Adi Mulyono, dan Fatchur Roji.Sedangkan Timnas Indonesia Putra B yang mengalami fall di babak final beranggotakan Kiromal Katibin, Veddriq Leonardo, dan Zaenal Aripin. Mereka harus puas dengan medali perak.Untuk medali perunggu diraih oleh tim Kazakhstan A dengan catatan waktu 20,980 detik. Tim ini beranggotakan Maimuratov Amir, Khaibulin Rishat, dan Kostyukov Roman.Menanggapi prestasi tersebut, manajer Timnas Panjat Tebing Ahmad Aziz mengaku bangga dan puas. Dia menyebut, nomor speed memang menjadi andalan Indonesia."Speed itu seperti sudah menjadi tradisi untuk dimenangkan. Jadi, kemenangan anak-anak baik di putra maupun putri merupakan tradisi kita," ujar Ahmad Aziz dalam keterangannya kepada Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI).BACA JUGA : IFSC ACC 2019 Jadi Ajang Uji Kemampuan Atlet Panjat Tebing IndonesiaKejuaraan Panjat Tebing bertajuk IFSC ACC Asian Championship 2019 dilaksanakan sejak hari Rabu (6/11/2019) hingga, Minggu (10/11/2019) mendatang di Pakansari, Cibinong.(Keterangan Foto : Istimewa)
text:
First Day Success, Rock Climbing National Team Capital At 2019 ACC Asian Championship IFSC
Nov 7 2019, 09:22 by Danang Sundoro



First Day Success, Rock Climbing National Team Capital At 2019 ACC Asian Championship IFSC



First Day Success, Rock Climbing National Team Capital At 2019 ACC Asian Championship IFSC


KBRN, Bogor: Indonesia's national rock climbing national team continues to fight today on the second day of the IFSC ACC Asian Championship 2019 Championship at the Pakansari Stadium, Bogor, Thursday (11/07/2019). Indonesia has dominated male and female speed relay numbers by winning 4 medals on the first day of the 2019 Asian Championship at Pakansari Stadium, Bogor. Two gold medals from the male and female speed relay numbers, plus two silver medals from the male and female speed relay numbers. The Putri A Indonesia National Team who won gold medals consisted of Nurul Iqamah, Raji'ah Sallsabillah, and Amanda Narda Mutia. In the final round, this team recorded a total time of 24.942 seconds. While the Indonesian national team Putri B who won a silver medal consisted of Dhorifatus Syafi'iyah, Mudji Mulyani, and Berthdigna Devi. They carved a time of 28,015 seconds. For the bronze medal in the women's speed relay number won by the team from Kazakhstan with a record time of 32,024 seconds. The team consists of Marienova Assel, Ulzhabayeva Tamara, and Agambayeva Margarita. Meanwhile, in the men's speed relay number, Putra A's Indonesian National Team succeeded in defeating its compatriot, Indonesian National Team Putra B, with a record time of 23.492 seconds. The Indonesian national team Putra A who won gold medals consisted of Sabri, Rahmat Adi Mulyono, and Fatchur Roji. While the Indonesian national team Putra B who experienced a fall in the final round consisted of Kiromal Katibin, Veddriq Leonardo, and Zaenal Aripin. They must be satisfied with the silver medal. For the bronze medal won by the Kazakhstan A team with a record time of 20,980 seconds. The team consisted of Maimuratov Amir, Khaibulin Rishat and Kostyukov Roman. Responding to these achievements, Rock Climbing National Team manager Ahmad Aziz claimed to be proud and satisfied. "Speed is like a tradition to be won. So, the victory of children in both sons and daughters is our tradition," Ahmad Aziz said in his statement to Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI). READ ALSO: IFSC ACC 2019 Becomes an Indonesian Rock Climbing Athlete Capability Test The IFSC ACC Asian Championship 2019 Championship is held from Wednesday (6/11/2019) to Sunday (10/11/2019) in Pakansari, Cibinong. Photo: Special)
